• Another aspect of the invention relates to a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents. The non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder is ultrafine, having a particle size of less than 1 μm. The bamboo powder has good moisture management properties. The preparation is an aqueous suspension comprising a functional additive, ultrafine bamboo powder, and an aqueous binder.
• The invention provides a method of preparing a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising wool as a functional additive carrier. The method comprises pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size, forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder. The wool suspension is then mixed with functional additives, such as ultrafine zinc oxide or ultrafine titanium dioxide. The mixture is then homogenized and made into a finer solution.
• The invention has been tested and demonstrated its effectiveness in enhancing the ultraviolet protection, moisture management, and wrinkle recovery properties of cellulosic fabric materials. The treated fabrics have shown improved UPF values, wicking heights, and wrinkle recovery angles compared to untreated fabrics. The anti-bacterial properties of the treated fabrics have also been tested and shown to be effective. The invention provides a new and improved method for treating cellulosic fabric materials with functional additives.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various parts of clothing.
* The traditional method of linking two tape-shaped knit pieces involves sewing them together, which can be time-consuming and may result in an uneven appearance.
* The invention aims to provide a connective knitting method that can join two tape-shaped knit pieces in a single knitting process.
* The method involves using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, where one or both of the needle beds can be moved in the longitudinal direction.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted in a specified length, with a boundary between them in the longitudinal direction on one of the needle beds.
* The loop portion of the final course of one of the knit fabrics is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed, which is the moving side knit fabric.
* The needle bed is moved so that the loop portion of the end part of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the end part of the adjoining fixed side knit fabric.
* A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, and this process is repeated until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined.
* The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch by repeating the process of forming a new loop on an overlaid loop.
* The invention can be applied to various parts of clothing, such as the collar of a sweater, the neck rope portion of a tanktop, and the lower end portion of baseball stockings.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system that brings ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, reducing the loss of residual solvent vapors from the interior of the tubs and common ducts. The air flow system is exclusive of the air recirculating system and includes a separate intake fan and duct. The intake fan is energized and a normally closed valve is opened in response to the access door being opened, allowing air to be drawn into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct. This minimizes the escape of toxic solvent vapors out the access opening.

• The dry cleaning machine includes a pair of nested tubs with a common horizontal access and an outer cabinet with an access opening in alignment with the open end of the tubs. The cabinet encloses the other operative elements of the dry cleaner, such as the drive motor, pump, and blower. The forward concentric openings of the tubs are spaced from the wall of the cabinet to accommodate a header chamber. The header chamber has opposed walls defining concentric openings that provide an access opening for the clothes.

• The machine operates through a well-known timer mechanism that controls the type of operation being performed. The operative cycle of the machine includes a washing portion, a drain portion, a spin or centrifuging portion, and a drying portion. The solvent flow system is continuous throughout the fill and wash portion of the cycle, recirculating the solvent from the storage tank through the filters, into the tubs, and back to the tank. The solvent flow system is altered to provide two separate solvent flow paths during the dump and spin portion of the cycle.

• The air flow system is controlled through a pair of airflow hoses and electrically energized one-way valves. During the stand-by portion of the cycle, there is no airflow as no blower is energized and the valves are normally closed. When the door is opened, a door switch energizes the exhaust blower and valve, allowing ambient room air to be drawn through the front opening and into the header chamber. This prevents the user from encountering solvent vapor fumes when loading or unloading clothes.

• The air flow system is also controlled during the fill and wash portion of the cycle, with no airflow as the valves remain closed and no blower is energized. During the drain and spin portion of the cycle, the valves are opened to assist in balancing the air pressure throughout the interior of the machine. However, once the drain portion is completed, the

<summary>

• The present disclosure relates to a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that allow sewing in a position specified on a work cloth. The sewing machine is known that can easily set a sewing position and a sewing angle, at which a desired embroidery pattern is to be sewn, on a work cloth. However, with the above-described sewing machine, it may be necessary to affix a marker to the work cloth. Further, after the sewing machine has set the sewing position and the sewing angle of the embroidery pattern, the user may need to remove the marker affixed to the work cloth before sewing is performed.

• Embodiments of the broad principles derived herein provide a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that enable easily setting a position, on a work cloth, at which sewing is performed. The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory. The at least one detecting portion is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source. The memory is configured to store computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave that has been detected by the at least one detecting portion.

• The sewing machine includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head. The bed is a base portion of the sewing machine and extends in the left-right direction. The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed. The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar such that the arm faces the bed. The head is provided on the left end of the arm. A needle plate is disposed on a top surface of the bed. A feed dog, a feed mechanism, a shuttle mechanism, and a feed adjustment motor are provided below the needle plate.

• The sewing machine includes a receiver that is provided at the lower left end of the head. The receiver is configured to receive an ultrasonic wave. The receiver has a rectangular parallelepiped shape that is slightly longer in the up-down direction. An opening is provided in the center of a lower end portion of the front face of the receiver. The opening has an elliptical shape that is long in the left-right direction.

• The ultrasonic pen includes a pen body and a pen tip. The pen body has a bar shape. The pen tip is provided at

<summary>

* The present invention relates to methods of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image. This method is suitable for use in a wide variety of consumer applications. The production of conventional textile fabrics is known to be a complex, multi-step process. However, the production of nonwoven fabrics from staple fibers is more efficient than traditional textile processes.
* The production of nonwoven fabrics involves carding, drawing, and spinning of fibers to form a precursor web. The precursor web is then subjected to hydroentanglement to form a nonwoven fabric. Nonwoven fabrics have commonly been disadvantaged when fabric properties are compared to conventional textiles, particularly in terms of resistance to elongation. However, hydroentangled fabrics have been developed with improved properties.
* The present invention contemplates a method of making a two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric. This method includes providing a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix. The precursor webs are then subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web.
* The present invention also contemplates the use of a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim to act as a fiber distribution control layer. This support layer deters the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers from becoming excessively intermingled with one another. The incorporation of a support layer improves the overall performance of the two-sided fabric. The support layer may be any suitable material, including wovens, knits, open mesh scrims, and/or nonwoven fabrics.
* The present invention provides a method of making a durable nonwoven fabric. This method includes providing a fibrous matrix, which can include staple length fibers, continuous filaments, and blends of fibers and/or filaments. The fibrous matrix is then formed into a precursor web, which is subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web.
* The present invention has numerous applications, including the construction of disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, and protective wear for medical and industrial uses. The material may also be used in apparel construction, such as for bottom weights of every day wear. The material may be utilized as a landing zone affixed to the disposable absorbent article. The material exhibits improved "loop" durability

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, aiming to improve the sewing properties by minimizing the impediment of the thread movement during the guiding of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing. The rotary hook arrangement includes first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing for controlling the rotation of the bobbin housing.
* The holding means which prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing are arranged so that they hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop and in particular the pull-back occurring after its maximum expansion, as little as possible. This is achieved by locating the housing side holding means on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing.
* The invention also includes a capsule release device that gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to slip through unhindered. This reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation to a minimum.
* The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, providing a jerk-free and low friction motion of the needle thread loop. The invention can be embodied otherwise without departing from its principles, and it has comparatively good sewing properties even without the use of a capsule release device.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through a simplified process that includes completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying.
* The washing process is critical, as it must reduce the amounts of certain elements retained on the yarn, including total sulphur, elemental sulphur, and metal ions such as zinc, iron, and lead.
* The process according to the invention produces a finished yarn with a high degree of whiteness, measured by the Hunter method, and eliminates the need for additional bleaching operations, resulting in a more rapid, economical, and simplified process.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process that employs topology optimization.
• The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be curved, flat, or complex shapes, and can be embedded in a matrix material, with the tendon elements being made of various materials such as carbon fibers, nylon, or metal wires.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and a method for embedding at least one stranded cable in a flexible thermoplastic material. The traction element comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength. The stranded cables are made by winding at least six peripheral strand cords around a central strand cord, which is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer. The thermoplastic plastics material layer is made at least partially capable of flowing, but without becoming highly liquid, and applied.
* The production line for sheathing at least one stranded cable with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material comprises an extruder with a thread guide for the stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted with and in relation to one another, individually, in a plane angled with respect to the cable plane. The stranded cables run through the extruder and the outlet opening of the matrix, lying on one plane. The thread guide and the matrix can be displaced relative to each other, changing the position of the stranded cables in the nozzle outlet opening. The plane angled with respect to the cable plane has an angle of preferably 45 to 135°.
* The method for embedding at least one stranded cable with a plastics material-coated core strand according to the invention involves unwinding the stranded cables, degreasing and/or pretreating them to improve the adhesion of the plastics material jacket, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material sheathing the core strands, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material. The preheating takes place with an induction heater, a flame burner, and/or a hot air heater, removing residual gases and improving the adhesion of the plastics material sheathing and the stranded cables.
* The production line for producing band-shaped traction elements begins at a system with reels for unwinding the flexible stranded cables and ends with a storage roller for winding the band-shaped traction elements. The production line comprises a cleaning system, a stand with a device for the exact orientation of the stranded cables, an induction heater, a flame burner, and a hot air heater for preheating the stranded cables. The oriented, cleaned, and preheated stranded cables pass through an extruder with a wire or thread guide and matrix, where they are sheathed with plastics material. The final dimensions of the

<summary>
* The present invention is directed to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel, which allows for simultaneous control of thread tension for the entire array and individual spool holders.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different spool holder, and a tensioning lever that biases the braking element and is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
* A biasing arrangement, such as a piston/cylinder assembly, is connected to the tensioning lever and is activated by fluid pressure, allowing for centralized control of thread tension.
* The biasing arrangement can influence the tensioning lever without hindering its swinging action, and can be used to increase the braking force when the warping machine is shut off.
* The tensioning lever can be oriented at an angle of 60° to 80° from the horizontal, and the biasing arrangement can be oriented at an angle of 30° to 40° from the horizontal in the thread direction.
* The arrangement can be used with a variety of braking systems, including a friction brake and an electromagnetic brake, and can be controlled by a switching valve system that connects to a conduit system providing fluid pressure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a bedroom cabinet with a dual construction comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, which provides excellent mechanical strength and allows for the formation of a clearance between the two casings to house electric devices or shelves without projecting them within the cabinet or from the outer periphery.
* The clearance between the outer and inner casings can also be used to form a uniform air flow passage for natural ventilation and to increase the sound-proofing effect, and can be adjusted by interposing spacer members with varying strengths in different positions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning. The methods involve combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution, which is then expelled from a nozzle or drawn from a film and exposed to a high electric field to form continuous fibers. The fibers are deposited onto a substrate and can be transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials. The invention also provides a method for continuous production of nanofiber strands and coated nanofiber strands.
* The invention includes four-component and five-component liquid silane inks that can be used in the formation of silicon-based films and nanofibers and composite materials. The four-component inks include a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, while the five-component inks include a liquid silane, a polymer, a solid phase, an accelerant, and a solvent. The solid phase component can be a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound. The invention also provides a method for producing an electrically-conducting silicon-composite electrode with a four-component ink or a five-component ink.
* The invention includes various examples of the electrospinning methods with different formulations of liquid silane inks. The examples demonstrate the functionality of the electrospinning methods with different accelerants and solid phase components. The examples also demonstrate the ability to produce crystalline silicon-containing materials using laser processing. The invention provides a method for producing an anode material using the electrospun fibers, which can be used in lithium-ion batteries.

<summary>
* The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that uses a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and increase oil production.
* The invention includes various embodiments, such as a multi-level discharge device, multiple pulse sources in multiple wells, and directional energy cones, to extend the effective range of the stimulation and optimize the stimulation effect.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device that can be used in a braced frame structure to dissipate energy during a dynamic event. The device can undergo plastic deformation to limit the loads levied on a structure during a dynamic event. The load-limiting device can be removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.
• The load-limiting device can be attached to a brace in the braced frame structure and can provide biaxial support for the braced frame. The device can be constructed of a plastic material or a metal-based elasto-plastic material. The load-limiting device can have an opening for attachment of a connection means to the brace.
• The load-limiting device can be used in various structural applications, including buildings, vehicles, aircraft, furniture, and roller-coasters. The device can be used to dissipate energy during a dynamic event by further yielding of the material in the plastic hinges of the load-limiting device. The load-limiting device can be checked after a dynamic event to determine if plastic deformation has occurred.
</summary>

<summary>
• The conventional sewing machine detector uses optical fibers for detection purposes, but it has several disadvantages, including the need for curved reflecting portions, which are difficult and expensive to machine, and the imposition of significant stress on the optical fibers due to their curvature. The detector also requires the use of regular lead wires for power indication, which can act as antennas and receive electromagnetic waves, causing interference with the control device. The detector's rotary reflective discs make it relatively thick and non-compact, and the vibration of the sewing machine shaft can cause the optical axes to change, resulting in an inability to receive predetermined signals. The detector's design also makes it prone to malfunction and requires expensive optical fibers to prevent problems.
• The present invention overcomes these disadvantages by using flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that are mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft. The light shielding discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin and have printed light shielding areas that detect the sewing machine speed and needle positions. The optical fiber supporter includes linear optical fiber fixing holes that lock the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers, eliminating the need for flexing the fibers and reducing stress on them. The light shielding discs are disposed between the first and second reflecting portions, which are provided by plating or attaching reflective plates.
• The present invention provides a low-price detector for a sewing machine that is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration and includes a thinner and more compact detecting section. The detector minimizes stress imposed on the optical fibers by minimizing the curvature of the optical fibers. The power indicating light is provided by an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere or adversely affect sewing machine control circuitry. The detector is also capable of stably detecting sewing machine control signals despite shaft vibration due to excessive wear, and it is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section.

<summary>
* The invention is a new and improved safe and door structure that provides a readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a first set of inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door. The door is retained in place by a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls.
* The safe construction includes a liner with laterally extending grooves for receiving bar members, which are then coupled together in spaced relation upon assembly. The door is dimensioned for being received in and completely removed from the open upper end of the chamber, and is secured in place by a lockbolt engaging a detent in one bar. The lockbolt is reinforced by safety bolts to prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure describes a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length, which can be used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each with transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip. The first and second wave plates are coupled together using a connective device, such as a threaded bolt, to secure the splice.
* The soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are coupled together using the splice, which includes a first perforation in the first wave plate and a second perforation in the second wave plate. The connective device is extended through the perforations to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate. The longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are clamped down by tightening the nut onto the bolt.
* The splice can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element and create a composite soil reinforcing element that achieves a desired reinforcing distance from the vertical facing. Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element. The composite soil reinforcing element can be used to reinforce a vertical facing in MSE structures, such as retaining walls, bridge abutments, and dams.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production. The plow blade includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for the ability to rebuild a blade, replacing a portion of the blade that may be worn. The fluid passage is defined by providing a small gap between the front surface of the blade and the rear surface of the leading edge section. This gap, combined with the total amount of weld gap, defines the volume at which the fluid will be ejected from the blade at a certain fluid pressure.
* The fluid pressure at a certain point along the blade's length will vary, and to assure that the fluid is ejected most aggressively in the critical high friction area, the tube can be extended so that it terminates at a position towards the bottom of this area. The number of leading edge sections that are welded onto the blade can be varied to match the requirements of a specific job, including specific installation depths. The location and length of the stitch welds can also be adjusted to tailor a plow for a specific application. This allows for a nearly infinite variety of configurations in an economic manner.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a deaeration tank for pulp that can be placed on top of an oxygen reactor, with no moving parts and a closed tank design to recover steam or oxygen. The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The locations and sizes of these elements provide optimum deaeration. The tank is designed to be small and efficient, with a diameter of 0.75 to 1.5 times the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
* The deaeration tank is used to remove oxygen from pulp after it has been treated with oxygen. The pulp is carried into the tank through the inlet pipe and splashes against the side of the tank, draining down to the body of the slurry. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom of the tank. The sensor controls the flow in the outlet pipe by operating a valve between the deaeration tank and the washer.
* The body of the slurry in the tank is swirled by filtrate from the washer. The velocity of the filtrate entering the tank is 6.1 meters per second at a 2% pulp consistency. The velocity may range from 4.57 to 12.19 meters per second. The filtrate enters the tank through a filtrate swirler inlet that has a vertical center line between the bottom of the tank and the surface of the slurry.
* The deaeration tank can be closed and built to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere. The tank is designed to be high enough to prevent the swirling slurry from spilling over the sides. The nominal height of the pulp slurry in the tank is 0.8 times the diameter of the tank. The tank has an exterior height of approximately 2 times the diameter of the tank.
* The inlet pipe of the tank has its center line between the upper surface of the slurry and the top edge of the tank. The inlet pipe should allow the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry and to splash against the side wall of the tank. The inlet pipe is usually located from the top of the tank a distance equal to 10-50% of the height of the tank. The horizontal center line of the inlet pipe is typically approximately 0.5 times the diameter of the tank below the upper edge of the tank.
* A 50 ton of pulp per day installation has a tank with an outside diameter of 106.68

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a lock device for a boom of a backhoe work machine, which prevents the boom from being rotated downward by its weight.
* The lock device comprises an engaging member, an engaged member, and a guide member, where the engaging member is a lock plate with a hook part and a slot, and the engaged member is a lock pin.
* The lock plate is attached to the boom and is guided by the guide member, which is fixed to the boom, to maintain the lock position at any rotation position of the boom.
* The lock device is designed to be easy to operate manually and to prevent the lock plate from slipping off or being damaged during operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter.
* The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
* The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and the present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber.
* The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and thus, the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.
* The laminated rubber is formed by piling up a thin rubber layer and a steel sheet alternately in multiple layers to place the rubber layers under restraint so that it will be hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
* The joint block is fixedly placed on the backing plate, and the laminated rubbers are integrally joined together through the thus mounted backing plate, allowing the occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations in vehicles to be substantially reduced.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil and gas well drilling operations, which can be mounted onto a drill string independently of threading on the pipe.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can move vertically along the mandrel, allowing for rotation of the retriever section during operation.
* The retriever section engages with the wear bushing through protruding members that fit into slots in the bushing, allowing for retrieval of the bushing from the hole.
* The apparatus provides a floating retriever section that can move vertically along the mandrel, eliminating the problem of crimping the walls of the wear bushing or damage to the unit itself due to the weight of the drill string.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at sites under construction. The invention aims to provide a novel guard rail support that is effective in preventing accidental falls, meets safety guidelines, and can be assembled and disassembled in an efficient manner. The invention is particularly useful in high-rise apartment and office building construction.

• Modern construction techniques require the erection of safety barriers or guard rails around the perimeter of uncompleted floors for personal safety and to prevent the accidental dislodgement of articles. The general practice involves the use of lengths of lumber stock, such as 2″×4″ boards, which are cut to length and nailed together in varying patterns. However, this method is time-consuming, requires more than one person, and often results in the destruction of materials.

• Various structures have been proposed to aid in the construction of temporary safety barriers, but most are impractical, expensive, and too complicated to use. As a result, a need exists for a portable and simple guard rail system that meets safety guidelines and can be assembled and disassembled efficiently. The present invention aims to address this need.

• A portable guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a safety barrier is provided, comprising a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail support is designed to be portable and easy to assemble and disassemble.

• The guard rail support comprises a rectangular upright column, a flat rectangular metallic base plate, and first and second L-shaped rail supporting brackets. The base plate has at least two bores for receiving fastening means to anchor the guard rail support to a floor or ground surface. The rail supporting brackets provide supporting means for wooden guard rails.

• The retaining flange is spaced apart from the upright column and is affixed to the base plate to receive and secure a kick board in position. The rail supporting brackets and retaining flange have bores for receiving fasteners to secure wooden guard rails within the brackets and flange. An angle brace is affixed between the upright column and the base plate for structural stability.

• The fall protection tie-off ring is affixed to the lower end of the upright column and to the base plate, providing a retaining and attachment means for a safety cable. The tie-off ring also serves as a means for fastening weatherproof tarpaulins or the

<summary>
• The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage, which can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
• The tool has a modular design that allows for the stacking of pistons to increase the available piston area and deliver more power to the stuck fish.
• The dump valve is reconfigured into an annular shape to keep the middle of the tool free and clear, allowing for wireline access and eliminating the need for a dart assembly.
• The tool can be operated with or without impacts, depending on the amount of surface overpull applied to the string, and can be used in stimulation or fishing operations.
• The tool's design allows for longer trouble-free service, reduced wear on moving parts, and the use of special materials to increase resistance to wear.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a track transport system, specifically a floor track system used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks. This system aims to prevent contamination of the treatment fluid and maintain a sanitary environment.
* The conventional method of chilling cooked meat products using air chilling has several drawbacks, including dehydration and shrinkage of the product, and a slow rate of heat transfer. This method also requires the use of a large volume of water, which can be economically disadvantageous.
* The use of fluid treatment chambers with a system for showering the meat products with a chilled brine solution has become a more recent approach to chilling cooked meat products. This method allows for quick transfer of heat from the meat to the solution, which can be recovered, recooled, and recirculated.
* However, the use of wheeled hand trucks to carry meat products into a sanitary chilling chamber has presented an impediment to the recovery and reuse of the cooling brine solution. This is because the wheels of the hand trucks can become contaminated with foreign substances, which can then contaminate the brine solution.
* The present invention aims to provide a floor transport system that allows dolly-like floor trucks to be used in a fluid treatment center in a manner that prevents the wheels or other support structure on the dolly from contaminating the treatment fluid. This is achieved through the use of an enclosed floor track system that segregates the hand truck wheel structure from the environment of the fluid treatment chamber.
* The enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the truck roll, and which is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs. The wheel channel includes opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate that overlies the top of the channel and is attached to it by a hinge.

</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc. The invention aims to provide a building system that allows panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height to be created and/or greater than 4 meters width to be created without movement joints. The system is designed to provide walls of considerable size and/or non-square or non-rectangular perimeter. The invention also aims to provide compliance with the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604.

• The invention is a building system that includes a frame or substructure, battens supported from and fixed to the frame or substructure, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported at least in part by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied as more than one layer. The plaster matrix penetrates the first mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the second mesh, and covers the second mesh. The wall has at least one opening selected from a group consisting of door and window openings. The opening is positioned only as allowed and is further reinforced in the plaster matrix.

• The invention is a building system that includes a frame or substructure, battens supported from and fixed to the frame or substructure, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported at least in part by a plaster matrix, and one or more additional mesh as regional mesh reinforcement. The plaster matrix is applied as more than one layer, penetrating the first mesh, embedding the second mesh, and embedding the regional mesh or meshes. The studs are of minimum cross-section of 45 mm×90 mm. There are dwangs at nominal 900 mm spacings between the studs.

• The invention is a stucco wall comprising or including a stud including wall frame, battens carried by the wall frame and in excess of the number of studs in the wall frame, a mesh or the like perforate reinforcement sheet(s) carried by the battens, a mesh or the like perforate reinforcement sheet(s) outwardly of and spaced from the batten carried sheet(s), additional regional reinforcement mesh, lattice and/or perforate reinforcement, and a plaster or cementitious matrix. The plaster matrix is applied as at least a two-layer application, penetrating the batten carried sheet(s) and embedding or also embedding the other said reinforcement(s).

• The invention is a building system that includes a frame or substructure, battens supported from and fixed

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to an apparatus and method of installation for a completely precast concrete retaining wall. The invention allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. Using pre-manufactured assembly components will save both on installation and transportation costs. The invention is also flexible in that the height or width of any of the individual components can vary over a wide range.
• The retaining wall of the present invention is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts: a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece. The face panel and counterfort are connected to the base using a shear key and grout. The connection between the modules is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar of one module into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout. This results in a shear cone in the base to resist the pullout of the rebar, ultimately connecting the two precast modular pieces.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during the pool cleaning operation.
• The invention concerns a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus having a central, vacuum portion that is readily adjustable relative to the pool bottom.
• Prior art devices for cleaning swimming pools using a suction source include a suction head connected to a flexible suction line and moved manually across the pool bottom using an elongated handle.
• A drawback of many prior art devices is the lack of an expeditious way to regulate the suction being exerted by the device during the cleaning operation.
• The apparatus of the present invention overcomes the drawbacks of the prior art by providing an adjustment on the vacuum head itself to enable quick and easy regulation of the suction being exerted.
• The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the suction head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.
• The invention also provides a roller height adjustment device that can be provided in kit form for use in combination with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies.
• The roller height adjustment device comprises a pair of frames, connector means, and adjustment means for vertically adjusting the axle of each roller construction within the slots provided in the end portion of the walls of the housings of the roller constructions.
• The invention allows for precise adjustment of the inboard rollers relative to the platform, enabling the effective suction of the device to be precisely regulated without having to adjust the suction at the suction source.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to the monitoring and measuring of fluid pressures in geological formations, particularly to measuring techniques that accurately measure fluid pressure at a desired elevation or depth without being influenced by pressures above and below the pressure measuring apparatus. The invention aims to overcome the volumetric problems with traditional standpipes and low-volume pressure transducers. It also seeks to isolate the pressure sensor in a borehole so that it is only exposed to the fluid pressure in the formation adjacent to the pressure sensor.

• The invention involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location. The filter is the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus. The conduit is pressurized with fluid to clear the conduit of any cement grout during this operation.

• The invention includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which involves forming a borehole in the subterranean formation and placing a conduit into the borehole to a depth so that a bottom inlet end of the conduit is laterally adjacent a location where the formation pressure is to be measured. A non-return valve is used in the conduit so that liquid cannot pass upwardly all the way through the conduit. A cementitious material is placed in the borehole until the cementitious material rises at least above the bottom inlet end of the conduit.

• The invention also includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which involves forming a borehole in the subterranean formation and placing a pressure sensing device connected to a bottom inlet end of a conduit so that the pressure sensing device measures fluid pressures at the inlet end of the conduit. The conduit is lowered into the borehole until the inlet end of the conduit is at a depth where the formation pressure is to be measured. The borehole is then filled with a cementitious material to a level substantially above the inlet end of the conduit.

• The invention further includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which involves placing a conduit in a borehole formed in the subterranean formation so that a pressure measuring inlet of the conduit is located at a depth where the formation pressure is to be measured. A pressure sensing device is connected to the conduit to measure pressures at the pressure measuring inlet of the conduit. The borehole is filled with a cementitious material above and below the pressure measuring inlet of the conduit.

• The invention provides various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure the formation pressures at desired depths. The inlet to the pressure

<summary>
• The conventional composed stave floors or engineering floors have drawbacks such as a thin sight substrate thickness, which leads to deformation and detachment, and a short lifespan due to poor glaze resistance. The conventional floors also require a uniform and level surface for assembly and a long cure time for the glue to harden.
• The present invention aims to address these drawbacks by providing a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate thickness of at least 12 mm. The invention also uses multidirectional holding means, such as dendrites and clamps, to prevent displacement or change of dimensions between the substrates.
• The example embodiments of the invention provide improved composed stave floors with increased durability, allowing for corrective maintenance and a longer lifespan. The floors can be manufactured with a variety of materials, including decorative or functional substrates, and can be designed to preserve the natural seams and properties of the wood.

<summary>
* The invention is a ladder attachment designed to improve the lateral stability of a ladder, prevent it from slipping or sliding, and increase the contact area with the work surface. This attachment allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.
* The attachment includes a brace assembly with a flange that encircles a rung of the ladder, a U-bolt that secures the flange to the rung, and a clamp that secures the assembly to the siderail of the ladder. The flange has openings for the U-bolt and a resilient pad assembly that pivots on the arm of the assembly.
* The attachment provides a non-slip gripping portion for the ladder that grips the work surface without damaging it, effectively increasing the contact area of the ladder with the work surface. This improves the lateral stability of the ladder and allows it to straddle corners.
* The invention can be used with various types of ladders, including aluminum and fiberglass ladders, and can be modified to accommodate different sizes and materials. The attachment can be installed by attaching the resilient pad assembly to the arm and securing the assembly to the siderail with a clamp and U-bolt.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, defining a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions. The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib in which the bridge and rib have a generally cruciform shape. The rib can be formed parallel to the collation or at an angle to the collation.
• The collation system is configured to minimize the amount of debris generated when the nail is driven into the workpiece. The collation system can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location. The collation system can include a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location. The collation system can also be configured with the connecting portion including a rib that extends less than an axial length of the collar portion.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom. The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail for lack of design elements which would protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack. The present inventor has discovered that existing down hole heaters inevitably fail because their designers do not take into consideration the intense pressures to which the units will be exposed when installed.
• The down hole heating system of the present invention includes production tubing, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit. The heating unit includes electrical resistance type heater rods, the electrical current for which is supplied by cables that run down the exterior of production tubing and connect to leads at the upper end of heating unit. The heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars are included to contain the heat from heating unit within the desired zone to the greatest practical degree.
• The present invention includes a method for use of the above-described system for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow. The method includes use of a down hole heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections, along with installation of the heat-retaining elements to properly focus heat on the producing formation. The present method may also be utilized by substituting cable for the down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore. This approach would be particularly beneficial in treating deep gas wells with an iron sulfide occlusion problem. The invention has been described with reference to specific embodiments, but this description is not meant to be construed in a limited sense. Various modifications of the disclosed embodiments, as well as alternative embodiments of the inventions will become apparent to persons skilled in the art upon the reference to the description of the invention. It is, therefore, contemplated that the appended claims will cover such modifications that fall within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, which aims to reduce gas consumption and improve engine performance.
* The system eliminates the need for springs and provides a substantially infinitely variable valve actuation capability.
* The system consists of a rotating cam and a translating means that interact with a controllable actuating means to control valve position.
* The valve actuation system is controlled by a computer, which allows for precise and timely control of the engine performance.
* The system can control the opening and closing of valves in any set of pistons, allowing for variable valve displacement and cylinder deactivation.
* The system can be used in various engine designs, including four-stroke and four-valve engines.
* The system provides a simple, robust, and efficient actuation system that is more easily manufactured, assembled, and installed compared to traditional cam-spring systems.
* The system can be used in various applications, including internal combustion engines with multiple valves per cylinder, such as four and six valves per cylinder.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control of the throttle valve. This system aims to improve upon existing systems by providing a smoother transition between automatic and manual control modes.
• The system comprises a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve, processing these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance. The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, allowing the vehicle driver to switch between automatic and manual control modes.
• The system allows for the vehicle driver to have full control of the vehicle in manual mode, and the control unit can be programmed to detect the transmission ratio in a continuously variable transmission and switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle. The system also provides a subroutine for switching from automatic to manual control and vice versa, ensuring a smooth transition between modes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine, which operates at high temperatures. The apparatus is designed to avoid the disadvantages of the known apparatus, such as high material temperature and complex casting.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls, which are used to bound the cooling channels, as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured. This approach has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region and no thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall.
* The use of inserts composed of metal or non-metal materials as a substitute for cast separating walls has several benefits, including reduced blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses. Additionally, the cooling system can easily be adjusted by replacing the inserts.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades which rotate at high speed, as it reduces the risk of bulging out of the inserts due to centrifugal forces. The inserts can be secured on one or more sides, for example by soldering or welding, and may be fixed in the blade tip region or in the blade root region.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate materials and operates efficiently, producing little slag or clinkers. It can effectively burn wet wood of 70% moisture content and is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the waste fuel. The volatile gases are then partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially in a first or primary combustion chamber.
• The invention has several advantages, including the ability to adjust to operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and the ability to quickly change the output Btu/hr of the heater. It also produces very little clinker or slag formation, requiring infrequent cleaning, and the combustion air is passed over the refractory lining, increasing its life.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industrial applications, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped tip and an injection button, providing several advantageous characteristics for its intended function.
• The nozzle is designed to facilitate the injection of silicone or other sealants in multiple industrial applications, and it has an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to facilitate the encapsulation of rivets or screws. The nozzle also has an injection button coupled to the end section of the bell or hood, with a special design that allows for sealing operations with greater accuracy.
• The nozzle has a button section that substantially improves the encapsulation and provides an optimum sealing of rivets and nuts, allowing the user to apply sealant operations both manually and by automated sealant injection machines. The nozzle is also designed to be used in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
• The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped section that is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts, providing a connection element for the injection button. The injection button has a circular main body and a peripheral groove section, with multiple series of radially oriented channels and orifices.
• The nozzle can be coupled or connected to most cartridges or machines containing sealant, and the sealant is expelled out of the nozzle via the bell or hood-shaped section. The sealant applying operations can be performed either manually or by an extrusion or manual gun.
• The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, which is very important for the pressurization and lifetime of aircrafts, ships, trains, or automobiles. The nozzle also simplifies the sealing work in both aesthetic appearance and speed of execution, reducing the sealant application time and saving time and labor.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. The invention aims to provide a simply and efficiently operable mechanism for establishing a mechanical connection with an object positioned in the well bore and applying sufficient force to remove the object from the well.
* The invention is related to the subject matter of U.S. Pat. No. 4,061,389 and is directed specifically to the improvement that promotes effective connection of a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and simple and effective disconnection of the pull tool from the article if such is desired. The invention is designed to overcome the common problem of inability to achieve disconnection from the worn fishing neck in the event the tool is unable to accomplish an effective pulling operation.
* The invention may effectively take the form of an external pull tool or overshot that is adapted for use in well servicing operations or an internal pull tool or spear, depending upon the particular service operation that is involved. The invention is effectively adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool and run into the well casing or well bore for the purpose of establishing a mechanical connection with an object positioned in the well bore and applying sufficient force thereto to remove the object from the well.
* The tool structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures of the tool causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object that is to be removed from the well bore.
* The invention provides a controllable locking mechanism that allows for selective positioning of the guide pin relative to the latching or unlatching slots. The mechanism incorporates a plurality of spring elements that ensure alternate latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism.
* The invention includes a compression spring element that maintains the inner body portion of the mechanism in an upward position relative to the outer housing. The guide pin is caused to move upwardly within the recess when the adjustable spacer element is moved into engagement with the upper extremity of the object.
* The invention also includes a latching control element that is positioned about the tubular portion of the inner body. The latching control element has an outer configuration that is merely reversed in comparison to the structure of the latching control mechanism illustrated in FIG. 2.
* The invention provides a mechanism for achieving actuation of the latching control mechanism,

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative refrigeration system that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding water vapor, achieving sensible cooling. The system operates by drawing a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air.
* The heat exchanger is designed to separate its dry and wet sides, with evaporating water kept separate from the useful air. The system also recirculates the working return air from the load to the wet side of the heat exchanger.
* The system can be configured to recirculate return air and bypass cooled air to increase the cooling rate and achieve a lower useful air temperature. The recirculation and bypass configurations can be controlled by dampers to regulate the amount of return air and cooled air.
* A hybrid system is also described, which combines the evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool the air and remove moisture. The hybrid system uses a minor portion of the cooled air to pass over the evaporator coil of the vapor compression refrigeration unit, resulting in a significant reduction in energy required to operate the unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect balance, and it also relates to a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft.
* The invention also includes means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft when the arrow points are not attached, and it utilizes the strength of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts by reducing cross-fiber stress at the end of the shaft.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes and provides a system where a sufficient, but reduced, number of components are used. This is achieved by providing an engine compression release brake for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, where the portion is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders. The system allows for engine braking using less than all engine cylinders.
• The engine compression release brake system includes a hydraulic system, an electronic control module, and a number of hydraulically and/or mechanically actuated devices. The system operates by activating the engine brake during the compression stroke of the piston, which vents the compressed air within the cylinder. The engine brake can be activated by the electronic control module, which determines the amount of braking horsepower required.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, and a light member includes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, the top side facing away from an interior of the aquarium, and the bottom side facing the interior of the aquarium. The light member also includes a lighting control region disposed on the bottom side of the housing.
• The lighting control region includes a first control channel associated with a first color of light, a second control channel associated with a second color of light, and a neutral channel, the lighting control region being sized to receive one or more light-emitting modules. The light member also includes a switch coupled to the housing, the switch operable to control the first control channel.
• The light member includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and to one of the channels to emit the white or blue light. The modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region and can be added to or removed from the light member at various locations.
• The light member also includes a single power cord that provides electrical power to both the control channel and the control channel. The light member can be controlled with two in-line timers that allow a user to set a time limit for various colors emitting from one or more modules.
• The light member can be used with various other types of enclosures and structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting beneath the cabinets. The light member includes switches that are disposed along either a side or bottom of the light member to provide for accessible control of one or more modules.
• The light member can include an optics member that is coupled along a bottom side of the light member, either by sliding the optics member along the bottom side or by raising the optics member up to the bottom side and snapping or otherwise coupling the optics in place. The light member can also include a remote control for operating the light-emitting module.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention aims to improve the performance of an internal combustion engine by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow while reducing noise from the air intake, and it achieves this by providing a tank with two interconnected pipes of different cross-sectional areas, one of which is narrow and located upstream of the air cleaner.
• The control valve is operated based on the engine speed and load conditions to create a new compound curve of volumetric efficiency, and the valve is preferably closed at any engine speed when the load is below a certain threshold, and opened only in the region where the load is above the threshold and the speed is above a certain value.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump described in the source document is designed to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure, making it suitable for applications such as pumping liquid manure from a reservoir. The pump has a unique design that allows it to operate at high pressure while maintaining a high volumetric flow rate.
* The pump consists of multiple pump heads connected in series, with each pump head comprising a housing, an impeller, and a drive shaft. The impellers are driven by a common drive structure, which is powered by a single power source, such as a motor.
* The pump heads are designed to be modular, allowing for easy assembly and disassembly of the pump. The pump heads are also designed to be removably connected, facilitating repair and maintenance of the pump.
* The pump assembly can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, allowing for easy transportation and operation of the pump. The support structure can be configured to permit submersing the pump into a fluid reservoir.
* The pump is designed to be efficient and effective in pumping fluids, with a unique design that allows for high volumetric flow rates and high pressures. The pump is also designed to be modular and easy to maintain, making it a reliable and efficient solution for fluid pumping applications.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention claims the benefit of two U.S. Provisional Applications, one for an Offset Compensated Position Sensor and the other for a Minimized Cross-Section Sensor Package, both filed on November 25, 2003. The disclosures of these applications are incorporated by reference in their entirety. The invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors. The invention aims to improve the efficiency and reliability of position sensors in mechanical systems.
* Many mechanical systems contain moving parts that need to be monitored and controlled for safe or efficient operation. A prime example is the operation of diesel engine fuel injectors, which are controlled either hydraulically or electrically. The timing and speed of fuel injection depend on the characteristics of the fuel being used, especially biodiesel fuels. This makes it challenging to monitor and control the injectors accurately.
* Mechanical systems like internal combustion engines contain a significant number of moving objects, such as fuel injectors, that need to be monitored. Each injector requires a separate sensor, which adds cost and weight to the system. A method of reducing the number of wires required for these systems is to provide output signals in the form of changes in current drawn by the sensor. This allows the sensor to operate with only two wires, one for operating voltage and current, and another for ground reference.
* Position sensors used to monitor moving objects generate an electrical signal proportional to the distance between the object and a fixed position. However, unwanted electrical signals, known as noise, are also generated along with the desired position signal. Noise signals are divided into low-frequency and high-frequency noise, with high-frequency noise being easily filtered out. Low-frequency noise, on the other hand, is more challenging to eliminate.
* Most position sensing transducers generate low-frequency noise in the form of a slowly drifting or static DC offset. This noise can cause problems in employing two-wire current output position sensors, as it adds to the temperature of the devices in the sensor, reducing its reliability. The addition of a static or DC current through the output sensing resistor increases the voltage dropped across the resistor, wasting power and requiring a higher power capability for resistors. This also means that the sensor wires must be increased in diameter to accommodate the increased power lost through their series resistance.
* The present invention is directed to sensing position or movement of an object. A position sensor signal conditioner and remotely electrically connected sensor monitoring equipment provide a method of multiplexing multiple numbers of sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring

<summary>
• The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner and a system for removably attaching heat utilizing appliances thereto, addressing the need for a burner capable of being used with diverse heat utilizing appliances.
• The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.
• The burner also includes features such as a shroud for tertiary combustion air, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a perforate food grate, as well as manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure, allowing for simple and effective installation by one person.
• The assembly consists of a stationary bracket attached to the mounting surface and an adjustable bracket attached to the product, which can be rotated into a locked position and secured with integrated hooks and tabs.
• The adjustable bracket can be adjusted to various angles, and the assembly can be tightened with screws to secure the brackets together and provide additional torque resistance.
• For pole mounting, the assembly includes a pole clamp assembly with adapters that can fit poles of various sizes, and a chain with hooks and wing nuts to secure the bracket to the pole.
• The assembly can be used to mount a variety of products, including speakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras, and is designed to be resistant to weather, wind, and vibration.
</summary>

<summary>
* The traditional in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in a rotary engine's water jacket passageway disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, leading to vapor collection and reduced heat transfer. This can cause thermal distortion and structural failure of the engine's housing.
* The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses, which improves the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surface and reduces locally high thermal conditions. This is achieved by offsetting the bosses with respect to the centerplane of the flow and skewing them with respect to the coolant passage.
* The staggered configuration promotes a controlled flow regime, devoid of uncontrolled swirling eddies, resulting in a higher heat transfer coefficient at the sensitive spark plug boss surfaces. This can increase the heat transfer coefficient by as much as 44% compared to the traditional in-line arrangement.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to minimize such flow disturbance.
* The method involves maintaining the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which minimizes turbine power changes during inlet control valve testing.
* The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves, and for the system with N-1 valves, is determined during the turbine design process.
* The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95% in a simulated system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a clutch unit of the oil shear type, particularly designed for large size power transmission requirements, such as in an aircraft catapult system.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates and discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for the dual purpose of retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
* The invention provides a novel and improved clutch unit that minimizes residual drag, has highly improved cooling, and allows for convenient inspections and replacement of disc segments without requiring total disassembly of the unit.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox. The mounting link is designed to withstand various loads, including routine vibrational loads and sudden or extreme shocks caused by hard landings. The most extreme loads come from "blade-off" events, when blades of the engine detach due to impacts or the like, causing severe shocks and often major damage to the working engines.

• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are expected to withstand a variety of loads, from routine vibrational loads to sudden or extreme shocks caused by hard landings. The most extreme loads come from so-called "blade-off" events, when blades of the engine detach due to impacts or the like, causing severe shocks and often major damage to the working engines. Blade-off event loads are extremely unpredictable, but can be more than an order of magnitude stronger than any other sudden or extreme shock gas turbine engines are expected to experience.

• Conventional gearboxes and gearbox connections are constructed to rigidly withstand all anticipated loads. Often, conventional gearboxes and gearbox connections may require additional material or be heavier to withstand such extreme loads. The mounting link is designed to provide a flexible connection between the engine and the gearbox, allowing for some degree of movement and reducing the risk of damage.

• The mounting link includes a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively retains the female link and the male link. The female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface. The radial interface dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.

• The pin can be designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure. This can be accomplished by selecting an appropriately durable diameter and material for the pin, and/or by priming the pin for shear with suitably shaped shear initiation points. The pin must be at least strong enough to withstand peak non-destructive impact loads such as low cycle loads from hard landings and other non-routine but expected shocks.

• After an event that can cause the pin to shear, fuse, or otherwise release, the female link and the male link are allowed to translate relative to each other. The female link and the male link can translate generally axially, and the frictional radial interface between the female link and the male link provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation

<summary>
• The invention is a small arms firing effect simulator designed for military training, which simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation. The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system. The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner that utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
