• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a technique for handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services. The invention allows existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. A blended call is a call that supports voice and multimedia exchanges of information. To create the blended call, a telephony server or a multimedia server sends calls to blender software.

• The blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment. The voice session may pass through the telephony server with an indication that blended processing has occurred. The blender further keeps control of the signaling paths of the parallel components so that the bearer path may be controlled to accommodate multimedia requests at any stage during the call. This allows for backwards compatibility with existing network systems.

• The present invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols. An exhaustive list of suitable networks and protocols is beyond the scope of the present discussion, but those of ordinary skill in the art will appreciate variations on the subject matter herein disclosed. The invention is based on a session initiation protocol (SIP) environment. A communication environment capable of carrying out the concepts of the present invention includes a communication network, which may preferably include a packet switched network with SIP enabled devices.

• Two clients are connected to the communication network, each with customer premises equipment associated therewith. The clients may have a telephone type device and a computer type device. The telephone type devices are directed to voice communications with limited data options, while the computer type devices have a monitor, a keyboard, user input devices, and other conventional computer features. The clients may contain data processing devices such as microprocessors which implement software that may be stored on any appropriate computer readable medium.

• The communication network includes a telephony server, which may be the CS2000 or DMS100 sold by Nortel Networks Limited. The telephony server may communicate with one another and other components in the communication network via a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T). Each telephony server may be connected to or integrated with a database server, which tracks which clients support which services. The database server may index the entries by a trunk line, a directory number, or other unique identifier.

• The communication network also includes multimedia servers, which may be positioned throughout the communication network as needed to provide the appropriate quality of service for the present invention. The multimedia servers are sometimes referred to in the industry as media portals and may be the Interactive Multimedia Server (IMS) sold

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention relates to the field of motion pictures and provides a system to view 3-dimensional and other special effects in motion pictures. The invention uses the Pulfrich effect, which creates a 3-dimensional illusion by delaying one eye's image by a fraction of a second.
* The Pulfrich effect is achieved by using lenses that darken or clear in response to electronic signals, allowing the viewer to see a 3-dimensional effect in motion pictures. The invention uses a computer algorithm to calculate the synchronization and control events in real-time.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a digital photo sensor to capture the viewed motion picture as successive images and convert them to digital images for processing. The computer processor processes the successive images and identifies the synchronization events.
* The invention uses a Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) to control the state of the left and right lenses based on the detected synchronization events. The GLCU includes a digital sensor, a processor, and a battery.
* The lens control algorithm uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect similar foreground objects in the successive frames of the motion picture. The algorithm identifies the synchronization events by detecting the presence or absence of foreground lateral motion.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope can detect lateral motion in a motion picture and identify the direction of motion. The invention can also detect head movement and account for it in the lens control algorithm.
* The decision procedure used by the real-time control algorithm to control the state of viewer glasses is based on processing of successive frame images. The decision rule determines if a synchronization event has taken place and if so, determines the type of synchronization event.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope can be used to view any motion picture with a degree of sustained lateral motion, including those shot on regular or digital film. The invention works equally well with any format of regular film or digital motion pictures.
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope provides a system to view 3-dimensional and other special effects in motion pictures without the need for special equipment or alteration to the motion picture. The invention uses a computer algorithm to calculate the synchronization and control events in real-time.

</summary>

* The invention is a foil electron multiplier that uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages. The foil electron multiplier is designed to amplify an incident electron flux or detect particles such as photons, ions, electrons, and the like. The invention can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates. The foil electron multiplier is particularly useful in electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.
* The foil electron multiplier comprises a series of thin foils held by foil holders in an evacuated enclosure that form discrete multiplication stages. The foils are arranged collinearly, although they can be arranged in an array along an arc. Voltage is applied to each foil to accelerate secondary electrons created by incident particles. The voltage on each stage can be applied using electrical resistors or separate power supplies.
* The gain of a foil electron multiplier is maximized by maximizing the electron transmission through the foil, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield. The gain is represented by Equation 2, which takes into account the probability of incident particle transmission, secondary electron emission yield, and transmission through the foil and support grid. The gain is also affected by the number of stages in the multiplier. The foil electron multiplier exhibits an intrinsic rejection of ion feedback at each stage.
* The foil electron multiplier design includes a range of foil dimensions from 0.5 cm diameter to 2×4 cm2, with a preferred embodiment of a round 1 cm diameter foil. The foil areal thickness can range from 0.2 μg/cm2 to 2 μg/cm2, with a preferred embodiment of 0.2 to 1 μg/cm2. The foil material can be carbon, silver, gold, chromium, or hydrocarbons such as Lexan. The foil thickness and applied voltage are directly related, with thinner foils requiring lower applied voltages.
* The foil electron multiplier uses a support grid to provide structural support for the foil, which is attached to the foil holder. The support grid can be made from conductive materials such as metals or metal alloys, or semiconductors, or insulators with a finite resistance. The grid can be attached to the foil holder using spot welding or designed as an integral part of the foil holder. The support grid is necessary for foils thinner than 1 μg/cm2.

* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, which can be used to image in a plurality of planes, including simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways. This invention overcomes the problems in the prior art by providing an image sensor in which information can be recorded through an edge surface of the sensor.
* The image sensor includes a semiconductor substrate of a first conductivity type, with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges between the surfaces, one of the edges having a surface which is receptive to light. The image sensor element is formed in the substrate and located adjacent the one edge, including a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region.
* The image sensor element includes a photodiode in the image sensing region, which functions as the image sensing region and is formed in the substrate by an N-type region. The charge collecting and transfer means in the sensor is a buried-channel CCD formed by an N-type region.
* The image sensor has a first imaging plane on the top surface, a second imaging plane on one edge surface, and a third imaging plane on the other edge surface. The image sensor element functions in a conventional manner in response to illumination on the top imaging plane.
* Photons impinging on the edge imaging planes generate charge carriers in the image sensing regions, which are guided toward the CCDs by the P+ layers. The P+ layers create a barrier to electron movement, effectively guiding the carriers back toward the middle portion of the substrate.
* The charge carriers are collected in the CCDs and shifted out in a well-known manner by means of voltages supplied to clock phase terminals. The image sensor can be used in various applications, including simultaneous imaging of a plurality of planes and color applications.
* The invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with techniques used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easy to incorporate in various types of known image sensors. The image sensor can be mounted on an insulated support block with interconnects to make connections between bond wires and leads.

</summary>

The terminal is adapted to reproduce sound on the basis of a first electrical signal and to record sound resulting in a second electrical signal. The converting means convert the second electrical signal into transmission data in a suitable data format and convert received data into the first electrical signal.

• The integration of high-dielectric constant oxides, such as ferroelectrics, directly on a semiconductor substrate is difficult due to the strong reactivity of the semiconductor with oxygen, resulting in the formation of a low dielectric constant layer. This problem can be solved by using a germanium buffer layer between the high-dielectric oxide and the semiconductor substrate.
• The germanium buffer layer allows for the epitaxial growth of high-dielectric constant oxides on a semiconductor substrate, and can also be used to prevent the diffusion of lead or bismuth from ferroelectrics into the semiconductor substrate. This makes it possible to fabricate non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory cells using ferroelectrics such as barium strontium titanate.
</summary>

• The invention relates to networks, particularly home networks, and aims to minimize power consumption while ensuring optimal administration. The home network includes devices that can serve as either a network master node or a network slave node. The network master node performs network administrative functions in addition to its nominal device functions.

• The network master node periodically broadcasts a beacon to each device serving as a network slave node. The network master node performs device association and authentication by maintaining a list of devices registered on the network. The network master node manages all traffic on the network.

• The network master node can enter into a power management mode to minimize power consumption. When the network master node enters into power save mode, it sends data enabling the network administrative functions to be performed to a network slave node. The network slave node becomes the new network master node.

• The network master node determines if there is any traffic on the network before entering into power save mode. If no traffic is found, the network master node enters power save mode. If traffic is found, the network master node sends a transfer request to the network slave nodes.

• The network master node determines whether any network slave nodes have responded to the transfer request. If no network slave node has responded, the network master node waits for a predetermined period of time and then returns to the previous state. If a network slave node has responded, the network master node sends data enabling the network administrative functions to be performed to the responding network slave node.

• The network master node selects a network slave node to transfer the network administrative functions to based on predetermined selection criteria. The selection criteria can be based on the visibility of the network slave node on the network or its intelligence/functional capabilities. The network master node can also select a network slave node that has been specifically selected by a user.

• The network slave node receives a request to transfer a network administrative function from a device serving as a network master node. The network slave node sends a request reply to the network master node, indicating that it will accept the transfer of the network administrative functions. The network slave node receives the transferred network administrative functions to become the new network master node.

• The network slave node determines if it is in a power save mode before accepting a transfer request. If the network slave node is in a power save mode, it does not accept the transfer request. If the network slave node is not in a power save mode, it accepts the transfer request by transmitting a request reply message to the master network device.

• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. The directional properties of antennae and the processing of phase and amplitude information from separate antenna elements have long been used for determining the angle of arrival of signals. However, low elevation angles are difficult to measure due to interference from strong unquantifiable reflections from the ground.

• A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of similar antenna elements was identified in U.K. Patent No. 1449196, which can be used to determine a function of elevation angle independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient. The prior art of UK 1449196 is illustrated in FIG. 1, showing a single equi-spaced triplet for which the two R.F. outputs A+C and B are functions of the elevation angle θ and the ground reflection coefficient p. The quotient of (A+C) and B is independent of a, p, r, h, and P.

• At low elevation angles, the ground reflection coefficient p approximates to -1, and the function S simplifies to S=f'(a, P, r)sin(2πh sinθ/λ). The measurement of elevation angle can only be made when S is non-zero, and is best made when S is changing slowly with angle near its maximum value. The value of h may be chosen to maximize the amplitude of S.

• The invention extends the ideas of the prior art to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles. The array may operate in a receive mode or a transmit mode, in which case the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded so that it can be identified. A common coherent carrier is required for the transmissions from each element of any triplet to achieve the interferometric performance.

• The antenna array comprises at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane. Each triplet is characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane. Radio receiver means are used to obtain from each antenna of each triplet an information signal of which both amplitude and phase relative to the amplitude and phase of information signals obtained from other antennae of each triplet are functions of the elevation angles θ of incidence upon the array of a radio wave arriving from a remote source.

• The present invention relates to multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems, specifically to precoder configuration in MIMO systems. The invention aims to optimize system capacity or bit error rate in MU-MIMO systems.
• The Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder provides the optimal capacity solution for MU-MIMO wireless systems, but its computational cost is often prohibitive. The invention seeks to reduce this computational cost while maintaining optimal capacity.
• The invention proposes a technique to realize a GDFE Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems, which significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss. The technique is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems.
• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (Szz) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise." This is the key component in conventional design of a GDFE Precoder and requires extensive computational cost.
• The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder and does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (Sxx) for downlink channel is rank deficient. The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The invention proposes a method for configuring a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a base station of a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system, which includes computing a filter matrix C and using it to compute the feedforward filter F, transmit filter B, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal. The invention aims to provide a solution that will provide a much longer bulb life by combating the mechanisms of bulb degradation. The solution should also help provide further protection from burns for users, regardless of the type of appliance in which the bulb is used.

• Small incandescent lamps, especially subminiature lamps, have a glass envelope which has traditionally been supported by a one or two piece base. The base typically has a low pitch thread for providing mechanical fixation to a socket, as well as for providing a conductor for one conductor of a two conductor subminiature lamp element. In most subminiature lamps of this type conduction for the other conductor is provided through a peg conductor centered in an insulator carried at the bottom-most part of the lower base.

• The upper glass envelope has to be supported. Normally a metal sleeve is employed which fixes movement of the conducting leads, aligns the envelope with respect to the sleeve, and permanently supports the glass envelope throughout its life. Current practices for holding a subminiature lamp in a metal housing employs a ceramic adhesive between the glass envelope and the inside of a metal support sleeve.

• The use of an adhesive to support the glass envelope within a metal sleeve has a number of problems. First, this adhesive eventually breaks down from repetitive use of the subminiature lamp due to the thermal cycling between the high temperature of the lamp's operating temperature and its return to room temperature. The subminiature lamp temperature can be as high as 300° C.

• Secondly, the use of any material to bond a glass envelope having a low thermal expansion characteristic to what is typically a metal sleeve having a much higher thermal expansion coefficient will cause a destructive shear each time the subminiature lamp is thermally cycled. This shearing movement, combined with other factors hastens the degradation of the adhesive material used within a subminiature lamp. The combination of the above four factors works together to cause conventional subminiature lamps to fail at an unacceptably high rate.

• The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer which directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope. The polymer may preferably derive support from a metal base. The polymeric material is somewhat rigid/molded and can be manually handled and used to manipulate the subminiature lamp.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure used in semiconductor devices to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections, resulting in lower electrical breakdown. This structure is particularly useful in high-speed and high-density integrated circuit applications with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators.
• The recessed mask structure is achieved by positioning a mask member below a surface to be planarized, where there will be a lower electric field, and removing mask material between points of high electric field concentration. This process allows for a lower and predictable overall capacitance, which is valuable for faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.
• The invention provides several beneficial features, including minimizing damage to the conductive liner during planarization operations and reducing the overall capacitance by recessing the high-k mask material below the locations of highest electric field concentration.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, which aims to enhance the heat-dissipating performance of the fan without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements. The heat-dissipating device is mainly composed of a housing and an impeller, and the housing includes an air inlet, an air outlet, and a passage connecting the air inlet to the air outlet. The passage is designed to guide air streams to flow from the air inlet to the air outlet.

• The sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side extends radially outwards with respect to a rotational axis of the fan motor or an axis of passage, which enlarges the intake airflow area and reduces noises of the turbulent flow produced. The inclined portion can be formed at the sidewall of the housing to greatly enlarge the intake airflow area and reduce noises. The inclined portion can also be designed at the sidewall of the air outlet side to significantly increase the heat-dissipating area of the air outlet side.

• The sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side may be formed with an inwardly inclined portion from the air inlet side to the air outlet side of the housing, which concentrates the air streams toward the center to provide better heat-dissipating performance. The fan housing assembly housing may be formed with a beveled edge at the air inlet side around the screw holes to enlarge the intake airflow area. The sidewall of the passage at the air outlet side may also extend radially outwards and protrude over the rectangular outer frame.

• The sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side can be designed into an elliptic shape extending outwards in a symmetrical manner, which enlarges the intake airflow area. The outward extension of the sidewall of the housing can greatly enlarge the air inlet area or air outlet area to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan. The dimensions of the blades of the heat-dissipating fan can be enlarged along with the outward extension of the housing.

• The passage formed by the sidewall of the housing of the invention has a gradually reduced inner diameter formed from the inlet side to the outlet side, which effectively concentrates the air streams produced when the impeller rotates toward the central portion. The air streams can directly flow toward the central portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature, and the heat-dissipating effects of the fan may be further enhanced. <summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages by plating the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
• The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
• The plating material can be a metallic material, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold, and can be applied using various plating processes and techniques.
</summary>

* The electroluminescent display panel according to the present invention is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer. The first and second electrode layers are formed into plural elongate stripes, and the plural stripes of the first electrode layer are disposed perpendicularly to the plural stripes of the second electrode layer. Each cross-section forms a picture element, and the first luminescent layer is made of a material which emits light including no visible red light components. The second luminescent layer laminated on the first luminescent layer to cover a part thereof is made of a material which emits light including visible red light components.
* The first luminescent layer is preferably made of ZnS:Tb or ZnS:TbOF which emits green light, and the second luminescent layer is preferably made of ZnS:Mn which emits orange light. The second luminescent layer partly overlaps the first luminescent layer, thereby forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion. The single layer portion emits green light at a low level voltage, and the double layer portion emits lemon light which is a mixture of green and orange at a high level voltage. The display panel is able to display different colors simply by changing the voltage level.

<summary>

* The invention relates to network implemented shared workspace environments and provides a system for spontaneously setting up a collaborative work-share environment between physically distant individuals. The system uses a telephone to make regular voice-only calls, and once a call is established, the telephones communicate with each other to determine if they have the capability for richer collaboration. If the parties decide to collaborate, they can initiate it by pushing a collaboration button.
* The system includes a collaboration control program that runs on each PC associated with a telephone and communicates with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button. The collaboration control program has the capability of launching a collaboration application program or bringing it to the foreground. It also has the ability to communicate with remote PCs via the LAN to request or respond to a list of collaboration application programs.
* The system uses a call control unit that includes a plurality of Phone Proxies, each associated with a telephone registered to the system. The Phone Proxies maintain the call state for an associated telephone and include a database containing the telephone number and IP address of the phone and the IP address of any PC associated with the phone. The Phone Proxies initiate call setup with the called party and enable the phones to establish duplex voice paths.
* The system provides a tear-down process in the event of one party hanging up on the call, where the phone notifies the Phone Proxy of the Hang-up event, and the Phone Proxy notifies the collaboration control program. The collaboration control program determines whether any remaining parties can collaborate, and if so, the collaborate indicators remain illuminated. If there are no remaining parties capable of collaboration, the collaborate indicator is extinguished.
* The system can be implemented in various ways, including using a separate connection from the phone to the LAN and PC, or using a one-wire-to-the-desktop configuration. The collaborate indicator and button can be implemented on the PC or the phone, and the system can be deployed in a system where telephone transport is effected via the data network or on top of dedicated telephone systems.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the insertion of clips or advertising sequences into a sequence of video pictures, aiming to optimize the visual impact of the advertising clip. The invention takes into account the regions of interest of the last pictures of the video sequence before the insertion point and the regions of interest of the advertising clips.
* The method of the invention generates a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point and a salience map for each advertising clip of a set of advertising clips. The salience map is used to determine the degree of similarity between the video sequence and the advertising clip.
* The degree of similarity can be determined in different manners, including calculating the correlation coefficient, the Kullback-Leibler divergence, or the average of Euclidean distances between the maximum salience points of the video sequence and the advertising clip. The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity is selected and inserted into the video sequence.
* The invention also relates to a device for processing pictures that implements the method described above, comprising a random access memory, a read-only memory, a processing unit, an input/output interface, and a man-machine interface. The device loads and runs the instructions of the algorithms implementing the steps of the method and outputs the enhanced video sequence into which the advertising clip was inserted.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local network (WLAN).
* The mobile terminal receives service information from the WLAN, which includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the WWAN base stations.
* The mobile terminal uses the service information to select a serving base station from the WWAN base stations, which can accelerate the connection setup time.
* When the mobile terminal fails to connect to the serving base station, it can scan the frequency channels using the service information or start an all-channel scanning procedure.
* The invention allows the mobile terminal to switch from WLAN to WWAN in a timely manner to avoid dropped or delayed connections.
* The mobile terminal can use this invention in various statuses, such as "call set up", "idle", or even in a calling status.
</summary>

<summary>

* The existing receiver input circuits have a problem of achieving a favorable compromise between small and large signal behavior, and low production cost, due to the limited dynamic characteristics of passive and active semiconductor components. This problem is mainly dealt with by selecting active semiconductor components and amplification control.
* The Siemens publication "Semiconductor Circuitry Examples" describes circuitry examples for TV tuners dealing with the above-mentioned problem, but the noise level increases with control attenuation, causing control actuation to be moved to high signal levels. 
* Another Siemens publication describes a circuit arrangement for the input section of an FM radio receiver with electronically tunable selective circuits, but the control signal is obtained in a narrow band from the signal input to the mixer, which involves the danger of overloading the preliminary and mixer stages.
* The existing circuits also have the problem of varactor diodes causing negative influences if they are subjected to strong signals, such as cross modulation and intermodulation, and relaxation oscillations. 
* The invention aims to provide a receiver input circuit that enables substantial elimination of undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path resulting in distortions, taking into account an adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
* The invention uses a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal being derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage. 
* The invention also uses a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage, and a third amplification control loop whose response threshold and frequency band width are lower than the response threshold and frequency band width of the first and second control circuits.
* The invention has several embodiments, including an input network with a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation, and a tunable selective circuit with elements connected between the terminal and the signal input terminal.
* The invention also has an embodiment with a separate supply and adjustment of the tuning voltage for the varactor diodes, which permits an iteration-free alignment of all tunable tuning circuits of the receiver input circuit.
* The invention has the advantage of protecting the distortion-forming circuit components against signal overloading during control, and also protects the following amplifier component against high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.
* The invention also has the advantage of eliminating interference through the control circuit if powerful amplitude-modulated spurious signals are present.
* The invention can be used in various applications, including TV tuners and FM radio receivers.
* The invention has several embodiments, including

• The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and screw thread specimen advance mechanism to prepare repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges.
• The method provided by the present invention enables the severing of foam test samples with at least two parallel cut sides, preserving the structure of individual cells for examination without distortion or mutilation.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a downconverting digitizer that utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down-converting A/D converter. This invention eliminates the use of discrete-time analog circuitry and greatly reduces the complexity of the converter design.
* The downconverting digitizer achieves three processes: conversion of the modulated IF signal to the digital representation, downconversion of the modulated IF signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components, and automatic control of the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise.
* The predictive loop of the downconverting digitizer generates a prediction of the input signal, and when the prediction is subtracted from the input signal, a prediction error signal is generated. The predictive loop minimizes the prediction error signal in the steady-state mode of operation.
* The sampler element converts the loop error signal from an analog to a digital representation, and the predictive filter element is implemented using digital signal processing techniques. The predictive filter element generates a prediction of the modulated IF at the next sampling epoch.
* The dynamic range of the downconverting digitizer is determined by the depth of the notch above the point at which the width of the notch equals the signal bandwidth. Increasing the order of the predictive filter both deepens and widens the notch in the quantized error signal spectrum.
* The downconverting digitizer has several advantages, including the ability to dynamically adjust the frequency response of the predictive digital filter, the use of a digital predictive filter and a multi-bit DAC, and the ability to select the frequency of the sampled modulated carrier to be fs/4, which simplifies the implementation of the predictive filter.

</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention aims to provide a method for preparing a superconducting device that maintains its superconducting state at the surface or portion close to the surface of an oxide superconducting material. This is achieved by providing a blocking film or passivation film that prevents the removal of oxygen from the surface.
* The blocking film is formed using a photo-CVD method, and oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface using ion injection or hot oxidation. This results in a highly reliable device with no oxygen deficiency in the surface portion, making it suitable for use in a Josephson element structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, which includes a wet gasification stage and a dry gasification stage. The wet gasification stage produces a combustion gas with a high hydrogen content, while the dry gasification stage produces a synthesis gas precursor with a lower hydrogen content. The combustion gas is enriched with hydrogen to increase the H2/CO molar ratio.
• The process also includes a Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stage, where the synthesis gas is converted to hydrocarbons. The hydrocarbons are then worked up to produce LPG, naptha, and diesel. The process also includes a water gas shift stage to convert CO to CO2 and produce more H2.
• The invention also includes an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility, which produces power from the combustion gas. The IGCC facility includes a wet gasification stage, a sour shift stage, a hydrogen-enriched gas expansion stage, and a gas combustion and expansion stage. The facility also includes a waste heat recovery stage to produce high-pressure steam.
• The integration of the CTL facility and the IGCC facility allows for the capture of CO2 from the off-gas of the IGCC facility. The CO2 is compressed and mixed with oxygen to produce a hot combusted gas, which is then expanded through a gas turbine expander to generate power. The exhaust gas is then fed to a co-fired waste heat boiler to produce high-pressure steam.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer to form a sensor device or a matrix of devices for multiplex detection of selected analytes. The method uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes. The nanotraces can be used as a sensor or for multiplex detection of analytes when anchored probe molecules are covalently coupled or synthesized to the surfaces. The fabrication of a set of parallel nanotraces serves to homogenize the total response to changes in local environment.
* The method involves depositing a semiconducting active layer over the entire wafer and patterning it into a set of parallel nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography. The nanotraces are perpendicular to and disposed across the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes. The dimensions of each semiconductor nanotrace are critical for increasing the response sensitivity to a level that provides practical direct electrical transduction of target molecule binding. The surface-to-volume ratio of each semiconducting nanotrace is large due to the small width and depth of the nanotrace.
* The invention also relates to a method for synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the active semiconductor nanotraces. The method involves coupling sensitizing compounds onto the surface of the parallel set of semiconductor nanotraces. The sensitizing compounds consist of probe molecules that are covalently attached to the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces and have specific affinity for different targets. The probes can be nucleic acid sequences, proteins, or other macromolecules that exclude or specifically bind different solution analytes or gas phase analytes.
* The invention further relates to a method for detecting target molecules using the multiplex detection array. The method involves packaging the multiplex detection array within a common fluidic-tight vessel that serves as the sample fluid reaction chamber. The target molecules bind with their complementary anchored probe oligonucleotide sequences on the sensor devices, causing a change in the source-drain electrical current. The change in current is measured and recorded, and the identity of the unknown target sequence can be made based on the known anchor probe sequence.
* The invention provides a cost-effective, time-efficient, and reproducible method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer. The method uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes. The nanotraces can be used as a sensor or

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers, especially those designed to operate on the ocean floor, and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by such a unit during its operation.
* Seismometers have become an integral component of geological research, especially oil and natural gas exploration, and the use of ocean bottom seismometers (OBS) poses certain problems not generally encountered in dry land seismometer operations.
* The present invention is a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination assumed by a seismometer in its operating position, such as an OBS on the ocean floor.
* The invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer.
* A geophone is suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat to form a free moving pendulum.
* A spring loaded plunger is positioned above the ball and is restrained from contact with its surface by a pin which passes perpendicularly through the plunger and is connected to a linearly acting solenoid.
* After the seismometer has been positioned for operation, the solenoid is activated by appropriate means causing the pin to be pulled from the plunger which, under the force of its spring, extends to contact the surface of the ball locking it, the shaft and detector(s) in their positions.
* The invention provides a mounting and clamp for a seismic motion detector which provide good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector.
* The angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft and detector(s) in their locked position and a surface known to be vertical when the seismometer is in the normal, up-right position.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to the production of multilayered components, particularly multilayered electrical components, and the products produced by the process are part of the invention. The conventional process for producing commercial multilayer capacitors involves several steps, including casting a ceramic slip, printing a registered matrix of metal pigmented inks, stacking and laminating the printed ceramic sheets, and cutting the compacted structure. The number of parts generated is determined by the number of electrodes in the printing matrix.
* The conventional process also involves thermal processing, which includes a drying and bake-out cycle to eliminate organic components from the green parts, followed by a firing cycle to form the final ceramic structure. Metallizing the ends of each individual capacitor element is necessary to achieve the desired electronic configuration. This is accomplished by applying a small amount of fritted silver paint to each end of the ceramic capacitor element.
* The controls necessary to achieve a satisfactory yield of capacitors of a specified value are indicated by the mathematical relationships related in the design equation. The equation includes parameters such as capacitance, number of active layers, dielectric constant, active area of an electrode, and fired thickness of the dielectric film. To achieve a given value for capacitance, one must accurately control values of these parameters.
* The invention aims to provide a new process that simplifies the manufacture of multilayered components by eliminating steps 4 and 6 of the conventional process. The process includes providing a first electrode and a first electrical component, locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component to produce a first laminate sub-assembly. Multiple first electrodes and first components may be formed on a first decal to produce first laminate sub-assemblies.
* The process also includes providing a second electrode and a second electrical component, locating the electrode in a recess formed by the second component to produce a second laminate sub-assembly. Multiple second electrodes and second components may be formed on a second decal to produce second laminate sub-assemblies. The decals may be manipulated to remove first or type A sub-assemblies onto a setter.
* The invention provides methods to interconnect electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies, locate sub-assemblies in precise registered relation, build-up stacks with covering components at upper and lower ends of the stacks, and achieve fabrication of such assemblies of many different sizes at very low cost and at high production rates. The process also includes the provision of apparatus or tooling to enable such fabrication. The resultant sub-assemblies and assemblies are also part of the invention

• The invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and related methods of using and manufacturing the same. The invention claims benefit under 35 U.S.C. 119(e) from U.S. Provisional Application Ser. No. 61/038,227, filed on Mar. 20, 2008. The invention was made with United States Government support under Grant No. N00014-07-1-0114, awarded by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency/Office of Naval Research.

• The invention provides a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. The unit cells can be of different orders, with larger cells being of a higher order than smaller cells. The unit cells can be of various shapes, including tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, or three-dimensional Kagome.

• The unit cells can be comprised of multiple cell sizes, with smaller cells being nested within larger cells. The nesting of lower order cells with higher order cells results in a lattice with a hierarchical structure. The unit cells can be connected through their respective ligaments, or they can be separate and not connected.

• The invention provides a method of making a structure, which includes forming a first lattice structure through the steps of providing a first primary array and an ancillary array, and nesting the ancillary array with the first primary array. The method also includes providing a second lattice structure, which includes providing a second primary array and mating the second primary array with the first primary array.

• The invention provides a structure that comprises a first lattice structure, which includes a first primary array and an ancillary array. The ancillary array is nested with the first primary array, and the second order cells of the ancillary array are essentially coaligned with the second order cells of the first primary array.

• The invention provides a method of making a structure, which includes forming a first lattice structure through the steps of providing a first primary array and an ancillary array, and nesting the ancillary array with the first primary array. The method also includes providing a second lattice structure, which includes providing a second primary array and mating the second primary array with the first primary array.

• The invention provides a structure that comprises a first lattice structure, which includes a first primary array and an ancillary array. The ancillary array is nested with the first primary array, and the second order cells of the anc

<summary>
* The conventional method of manufacturing a semiconductor device has difficulties in determining the time at which anisotropic RIE should be terminated, leading to variable width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall.
* The present invention aims to improve the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall and to provide a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device in which an LDD structure can be formed by a low temperature process.
* The invention involves forming an insulating film on the gate electrode, depositing a conductive or polycrystalline semiconductor layer, and anisotropically etching it using RIE to form a portion on the gate sidewall.
* The method of fabricating a semiconductor device according to this invention is further featured by siliciding a desired portion of the gate electrode or the gate electrode and the source/drain region in fabricating the insulated gate field effect semiconductor device having the LDD structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* Protective helmets with hard outer shells and resilient liner assemblies are well known in the art, but they often require adjustable straps to accommodate various head sizes.
* Previous methods for making custom-fitted helmets have limitations, such as the need for direct handling of foaming agents or the complexity of preformed liners.
* A known method involves injecting foam into the space between the outer shell and an elastic layer, but it is not practical for field use.
* Another method uses a preformed liner with foamable mixture cells, but it is also complex and expensive.
* A third method involves using hollow epoxy balloon spacer elements, but it requires arranging the layers in register and using drawstrings for tension.
* The inventor's previous solution used thermoplastic sheets with hollow epoxy balloon spacer elements, but it had limitations such as the need for register and the use of drawstrings.
* The current invention provides a helmet liner with a plurality of layers, each consisting of an elastic thermoplastic sheet formed with an array of pockets.
* The liner is fitted to an individual wearer's head by heating the sheets, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the head, and removing it when cooled.
* The liner is simple and inexpensive to manufacture, and it can be refitted to accommodate a changed head size without shifting position or requiring drawstrings.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices for producing electrical power from surface waves on a water body, specifically wave energy converters that capture energy from subsurface differences in hydrostatic pressure and/or enhanced surge or pitch.
* The device consists of one or more gas tight containers submerged to a depth slightly below anticipated wave and swell troughs, with a fixed depth rigid end and a movable rigid end connected by a flexible, gas tight, reinforced bellows.
* The device captures both hydrostatic (heave) and hydrokinetic wave energy (surge or pitch), and can be adjusted for tides and optimized energy capture or protection from severe sea-states.
* The device can be oriented vertically, horizontally, or in any other orientation, and can be connected to a floating overhead device to increase stroke, energy capture, and efficiency.
* The device can be modified to include features such as a force multiplier, leveraged connecting means, multi-staged or multiple sequenced drive cylinders, and a floating surface vent buoy to enhance energy capture and efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a relative humidity sensing element that is energized by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation, does not depend on mechanical movements, and is physically sturdy and requires no special physical protection. It is also non-hygroscopic, so moisture only permeates the element and is not attracted by it nor collected in it. The element has a response time on the order of one second.
• The humidity sensing element of the present invention comprises a first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric, and a second electron conductive electrode pervious to moisture vapor. The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere in a suitable range of interest when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage. The element is suitable for excitation by a ten Hertz sine wave alternating current electrical voltage.
• The preferred method of manufacturing the humidity sensing element includes forming the first electrode from commercially pure aluminum and anodizing the aluminum to form the dielectric coating, vacuum depositing atomic particles of nickel into the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric, and vacuum depositing nickel onto the sealed anodized coating to form the second electrode. The anodized layer is then hydrolized and sealed to contact the nickel particles with ion-forming material. The second electrode is formed by a deposit of nickel in quantity equivalent to an amount calculated for deposition of a layer approximately 100 Angstrom units thick on a smooth non-porous surface.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a switching regulator circuit that operates at high efficiency and produces low electromagnetic interference (EMI) output, making it suitable for driving large digital displays such as those used in the Apple iPhone.
* The circuit achieves this by interleaving parallel source and drain paths, which cancel out the EMI generated in each path, and optionally using terminal paths to absorb any remaining EMI.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to Internet telephony and provides an improved end-user interface for IP telephone communication. It aims to overcome the disadvantages of conventional IP telephones, which require high-performance PCs and extra sound equipment. The invention seeks to provide a low-cost, efficient, and convenient IP telephone solution.
* The conventional IP telephone consists of a high-end PC, which is power-hungry, oversized, and expensive. It requires a long boot-up time and does not include a comfortable end-user telephone handset. The relative distance between the PC microphone and PC speaker can cause disturbing echoes for system users.
* The present invention teaches that a radio telephone can be enhanced to work in conjunction with a PC-based telephony application. This allows computationally intensive speech coding and decoding to be performed external to the PC. The enhanced radio telephone can be used with a relatively low-performance PC for effective IP telephony.
* The enhanced wireless telephone includes a speech compressor, a digital interface, a speech decompressor, and an external connection. It can transmit and receive digitized and coded speech signals via the external connection as well as via wireless communication. The enhanced radio telephone can selectively operate as either a conventional radio telephone or as an improved IP telephone.
* The invention provides several advantages, including reduced speech delay, lower cost, and improved convenience. The enhanced radio telephone handset is convenient for speech conversation and reduces echo problems associated with conventional IP telephones. The PC need not perform speech coding and decoding, allowing it to be implemented as a low-end computer.
* The invention can be implemented in various ways, including using a standard serial or parallel PC cable connection or well-known IR or shortwave radio techniques. The enhanced radio telephone and the PC can be programmed to control IP-telephone operation from either the PC or the enhanced radio telephone. Switching between IP-telephone operation and wireless-telephone operation can be initiated manually or automatically via the telephony application running on the PC.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool used in various technologies, including machining, cutting, punching, molding, and forming work. The fixing mechanism is designed to improve the prior art by providing a simple and secure way to fix the tool in place. The mechanism uses a curved surface to connect the tool frame and the tool holder, allowing for easy mounting and release of the tool.
* The curved surface is designed to transmit machining forces between the tool frame and the tool holder, and can also transmit loads in a direction perpendicular to the mounting direction due to frictional contact. The mechanism can be used in various types of robot applications, automatic devices, and pneumatic tools, and is particularly advantageous for use in cutting, punching, molding, and forming work. The invention provides a cost-effective and reliable solution for fixing tools in place, reducing the complexity and disturbances associated with prior art mechanisms.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with a force transmission structure, which includes a drive plate and a shaft. The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area, and the shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole. This design allows the shaft to be fixed to rotate with the drive plate, reducing vibration and noise. The drive plate and shaft are preferably made of plastics and metal materials, respectively.
* The force transmission structure is designed to transmit rotation of the output shaft of the motor to the lift device, which moves the glass of the window up or down. The drive plate has a coupling with a Y-shaped mounting hole, and the shaft has a Y-shaped toothed portion that fits into the mounting hole. The drive plate is driven by the worm gear through the damper, and the shaft is rotated by the drive plate to drive the capstan of the window lift system. The pinion of the shaft drives the gear of the window lift system to raise or lower the glass of the window.
* The invention provides a stable and quiet operation of the motor assembly, as the three equal forces exerted on the three teeth of the toothed portion of the shaft constitute a triangle, allowing the shaft to be rotated stably. The contact area between the teeth of the shaft and the coupling of the drive plate is greater than that in the traditional design, enabling the connection between the coupler and the shaft to withstand a greater torque. The drive plate is made of an engineering plastics material, which has good strength and resistance to impact, and can absorb vibration to reduce noise. The buffer holes in the coupling aid molding of the drive plate by providing relief when the plastics material is cooling in the mould.
* The motor assembly comprises a motor, a gear train, a force transmission structure, and a window lift system. The gear train includes a worm, a worm gear, a damper, a drive plate, and a shaft. The force transmission structure comprises the drive plate and the shaft, which are connected by the Y-shaped mounting hole and toothed portion. The window lift system includes a capstan, a gear train, and a wire that is wound about the capstan to raise or lower the glass of the window.

* The present invention relates to a device for interconnecting high voltage cables with apparatus and/or other high voltage cables, consisting of a cable termination and a rigid insulator. The invention aims to provide a simplified connection system for high voltage cables with ratings up to 400 KV and above.
* The device features a common cable connection system for all accessories and interconnections, resulting in advantages such as factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, and simplified field testing. The stress cone design and dimensions are the same for all applications, with the only variation being the diameter of the cable or apparatus entrance.
* The invention includes three interface methods: the inner cone concept, the outer cone concept, and the no cone or slight inner cone concept. The outer cone concept is preferred due to its ease of expansion and reduced risk of glow discharges.
* The device consists of a cable termination and an interface device, with the latter including a rigid insulating body and a conical interface surface. The rigid insulator has a specific angle between 15° and 45°, which is essential for optimizing the product's high operating reliability in high or extra high voltage installations.
</summary>

• The invention is a multiorifice wafer structure having a plurality of angularly disposed passages and a method for making the multiorifice structure. The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods interspaced with cylindrically shaped members. Each successive layer of rods is disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the fused assembly. The fused assembly of cylinders and rods is then cut into relatively thin wafers.

• The multiorifice structure is used in conjunction with an automotive type fuel injector valve for atomizing the fuel being injected into an internal combustion engine. The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members. The rods are angularly disposed with respect to the axis of the concentric cylindrical members. The fused assembly of cylinders and rods is then cut into relatively thin wafers.

• The invention has several advantages over the prior art, including the ability to produce a multiorifice structure with a plurality of angularly disposed passages. The triangular shaped orifices are more effective in the atomization of the exiting fluid than the circular orifices of the prior art. The surface tension forces acting on the exiting fluid tend to cause the exiting fluid stream to oscillate. The exiting fluid stream will break up into smaller particles than would be achieved with circular orifices having the same effective aperture.

• The multiorifice structure can be fabricated using a simple and economical method. A central or core rod is circumscribed by six or more rods or wires. The first layer of rods are twisted about the core and rod, so that their axis are disposed at a predetermined angle with respect to the axis of core rod. The rods are then sheathed in a cylindrical member.

• The rods and cylindrical members may be coated with a thin layer of material having a lower melting temperature than the materials of the rods and cylindrical members. This coating material may be deposited on the surface of the rods and cylindrical members by electroplating, dipping, vapor deposition or any other way known in the art. The coating material may be copper, nickel, tin, or any other suitable material having a lower melting temperature. The multiorifice structure need not be made from metals, and glass as well as plastic materials may be used.

• The fused assembly is sliced or cut using any of the known methods to produce a plurality of thin multiorifice structures. The sliced surfaces of the multiorifice structures may subsequently be ground or polished to produce required surface finish or uniformity

* The text describes a method for determining the desired voltage for a battery pack in a vehicle, taking into account the varying capacities of individual cells. This is done by calculating the required cell voltage using the minimum Amp-hr cell assumption and summing the string energy. The desired voltage is then determined by comparing the calculated energy with the required trip energy.
* The text also describes a method for balancing and charging the battery pack, which involves determining the charge time for the battery pack and the resistive circuitry activation time for each cell. If the charge time is greater than the maximum resistive circuitry activation time, the algorithm activates the resistive circuitry for each cell and enables the battery charger. Once the resistive circuitry activation time has expired for all cells, the battery pack is charged to the target voltage.
</summary>

• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at a predetermined value set by a potentiometer, reducing eye fatigue and preventing myopia.
• The converter includes various circuits such as input protection, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, and control circuit to regulate the output voltage and prevent electromagnetic radiation.
• The invention can be used in various applications such as bus AC to DC converter, PFC converter, computer power supply, TV power supply, and electronic ballast, among others.
</summary>

• The present invention is related to wireless communication systems, specifically systems and methods for detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals in wideband code division multiple access (WCDMA) systems. The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver. The mobile time reference is used to maintain the timing of the portable transceiver and to recover multipath signals. The invention is particularly useful in 3G wireless communication systems.

• The invention includes a free running counter (FRC) that generates the mobile time reference using a high frequency clock and a low frequency clock. The FRC is coupled to a temperature controlled crystal oscillator (TCXO) and a crystal oscillator (CO). The TCXO provides a 30.72 MHz clock signal, while the CO provides a 32 KHz clock signal. The FRC uses the 30.72 MHz clock signal to generate the mobile time reference in active mode.

• The FRC operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz and 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active mode or idle mode. In idle mode, the TCXO is turned off, and the FRC uses the 32 KHz clock signal to maintain the mobile time reference. The FRC provides a timing reference for the portable transceiver system and for acquiring the parameters required to recover the multipath signals. The mobile time reference is constantly running and has an accuracy of approximately 32 nanoseconds.

• The FRC includes a TCXO circuit, a phase locked loop (PLL), a counter, a drift estimator, and a correction circuit. The TCXO circuit generates the mobile time reference using the 30.72 MHz clock signal. The PLL phase locks the 32 KHz clock signal to the 30.72 MHz clock signal for improved performance. The counter counts the cycles of the 32 KHz clock signal.

• The drift estimator provides an estimate of the drift of the 32 KHz clock signal for use by the correction circuit. The estimate of drift includes both the drift and bias of the clock as provided by a Kalman estimation. The correction circuit updates the mobile time reference using the count and the drift estimate. The mobile time reference is maintained during the idle mode.

• The invention pertains to the field of scraped surface heat exchangers, specifically the mounting of blades onto the central drive shaft. The blades are used to mix and scrape the inside surface of the outer tube in a scraped surface heat exchanger. The blades are typically hingedly connected to the central drive shaft and are restrained by pins. The pins are welded onto the drive shaft and have a narrow protruding finger and an opposed wider finger.

• The blades are generally installed on the drive shaft at a time when the drive shaft is removed from the outer tube of the scraped surface heat exchanger. Installation occurs not only at initial setup but also after each cleaning cycle of the device. During insertion of the drive shaft into the scraped surface heat exchanger tube, it is desirable that the blades remain at a shallow angle. The blades need to be held at their relatively shallow angle during installation so that they fit within the diameter of the outer tube.

• In the case of a horizontally and vertically arranged scraped surface heat exchanger, this practice may be somewhat cumbersome and require tying strings around the blades to hold them in. The blades may be accomplished by the user holding the blades in with their hands as the drive shaft is inserted into the outer tube. Due to the length of a drive tube, there are typically several blades arranged at regular intervals longitudinally along a single drive shaft. The blades are generally arranged with four blades, each at a 90° angle to each other, around the circumference of the drive tube.

• If the blades are permitted to swing outwardly to their installation position, they may be able to freely slide away from the pin. This problem becomes even more severe in the case of a vertically arranged scraped surface heat exchanger. In order to permit a shaft to fit within a tube of the same length, it is known to mount the tubes quite high above the floor surface. The drive shaft is inserted using a hydraulic lift controlled by a manually actuated lever at the floor level.

• The invention provides a method and apparatus to facilitate the mounting of a scraped surface heat exchanger blade onto a drive shaft, while still using a pin type connection. The blade includes a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge. The blade has at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body generally proximate to the hinge edge. The blade also has a first L-shaped locking track protruding into the first side of the blade.

The process involves using at least one optical checking element to detect an image of a plurality of cigarettes, evaluating the image using an image-processing device, and producing an error signal if the image deviates from a reference image or value. The apparatus includes an optical checking element, an image-processing device, and means to produce an error signal. The process and apparatus can detect transversely located cigarettes and other defects, such as missing filters or bent or broken cigarettes.
* The invention aims to improve the avoidance of disruptions in the cigarette magazine, which can occur when a transversely located cigarette blocks individual shafts or shaft groups. The process and apparatus can detect disruptions and eliminate them automatically or manually. The apparatus includes an ejecting unit that can be actuated to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the ejecting unit. The apparatus can produce an error signal if the image deviates from the reference image or value. • The current funding system for the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) relies on excise taxes, which have been criticized for not accurately reflecting the costs imposed by users on the National Airspace System (NAS). The system has raised concerns about revenue adequacy, equity, and efficiency, as users are not directly charged for the costs they impose on the NAS.
• Alternative funding options, such as a fuel tax, weight/distance charges, en-route charges, flight segment charges, and certification charges, have been proposed to address these concerns, but each option has its advantages and disadvantages, and would require significant administrative and transition efforts.
</summary>

<summary>
• The Government Accountability Office (GAO) has been assessing strategic sourcing in federal acquisitions for over a decade, finding that leading companies have committed to a strategic approach to acquiring services, resulting in substantial savings. This approach involves developing knowledge of spending, taking an enterprise-wide approach, and leveraging buying power.
• The GAO has emphasized the importance of comprehensive spend analysis for efficient procurement, but federal agencies face challenges in obtaining and analyzing reliable data on spending, securing expertise, and developing metrics. Agencies have reported difficulties in gathering data to form the basis for their spend analysis.
• The GAO has identified several disincentives that can discourage procurement and program officials from proactively participating in strategic sourcing, including a perception that reporting savings could lead to program budgets being cut. However, some agencies have introduced practices to address these disincentives, such as increasing personal incentives for key managers.
• The GAO has found that leading companies have successfully implemented strategic sourcing practices to manage services, achieving savings of 4 to 15 percent over prior year spending. Companies have developed category-specific procurement strategies, focused on total cost of ownership, and regularly reviewed strategies and tactics to improve knowledge about their procurement environment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) created the Superfund program in 1980 to clean up the nation's most severely contaminated hazardous waste sites. The program has been extended and is now considering another reauthorization. Under CERCLA, EPA investigates contaminated areas and places the most highly contaminated sites on the National Priorities List (NPL) for study and cleanup. EPA requires incinerators at Superfund sites to meet RCRA's substantive requirements, such as the act's standards for emissions.
• EPA employs various techniques to ensure the safe operation of Superfund incinerators, including mechanical features, operational procedures, and oversight activities. However, residents of the areas surrounding incinerators frequently desire an extra degree of assurance that the incinerators are operating safely. EPA has not followed through on other opportunities to improve its oversight of incinerators and provide additional assurance to the public. To address this, the GAO recommends that EPA implement its guidance for having RCRA hazardous waste incinerator inspectors evaluate Superfund incinerators.
</summary>

* The Mexican government has been combating the growing power of criminal groups, known as DTOs, for almost a decade, with a shift in emphasis towards reducing criminal violence under President Enrique Peña Nieto.
* Mexican DTOs' criminal activity extends to human trafficking, kidnapping, money laundering, extortion, bribery, racketeering, and weapons trafficking, with a constant supply of firearms and ammunition required to assert control over territory.
* Firearms trafficked from the United States to Mexico are primarily transported overland using the same routes and methods employed for smuggling bulk cash and drugs, with DTOs often relying on "straw purchasers" to acquire firearms.
* The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) and Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) are the primary agencies combating illicit sales and trafficking of firearms across the Southwest border.
* From 2009 to 2014, 73,684 firearms seized in Mexico were found to have originated in the United States, with most coming from Texas, California, and Arizona, and the majority being long guns, including rifles and shotguns.
* The use of weapons parts transported to Mexico to be later assembled into finished firearms is an emerging trend, with ATF and ICE taking steps to improve coordination on efforts to combat firearms trafficking.
* The Office of National Drug Control Policy (ONDCP) has not reported progress made on the strategic objective in the Weapons Chapter in 2011 or 2013, and a more comprehensive indicator is needed to accurately reflect progress made by ATF and ICE in meeting the strategic objective.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a system for controlling daylight and artificial illumination in a space, including a sensor for sensing an illumination level in at least a portion of the space, a plurality of dimmable electric lamps, and a control system controlling the dimming levels of the plurality of electric lamps. The control system adjusts the dimming level of each lamp to achieve a desired illumination level in the respective zone according to the desired illumination profile and compensate for the daylight illumination in the space throughout at least the portion of the day. The dimming level of each lamp is selected by the control system from one of a plurality of lighting presets, each preset comprising a combination of dimming levels of the lamps.

• The system also includes a sensor for sensing daylight illumination entering the space, a control system controlling the at least one window treatment, and the control system operating to adjust the window treatment in the event of sun glare through the opening to reduce the sun glare. The control system stops adjusting the at least one window treatment when the sun glare has been minimized. The system has the potential to automatically recalibrate based on immediate or repeated occupant input resulting in increased occupant satisfaction.

• The invention also comprises a method for maintaining a desired illumination profile in a space throughout at least a portion of a day where the illumination sources include daylight and artificial light. The method comprises sensing an illumination level in at least a portion of the space, supplementing the daylight illumination of the space with a plurality of electric lamps providing artificial light, and controlling with a control system responsive to the sensed illumination level the dimming levels of the plurality of electric lamps to maintain the desired illumination profile in the space.

• The system includes a central processor, a dimming panel, and a photosensor interface, which are connected to a digital communication link. The photosensor interface is coupled to one or more photosensors, which are for control of the interior lights. The photosensor interface is also coupled to a further photosensor interface, which is coupled to one or more photosensors for sensing daylight entering the room.

• The central processor manages the lighting for an entire facility and allows the user to create and recall custom preset scenes for common room activities. The central processor includes an astronomical time clock, which is capable of scheduling events based on sunrise and sunset times. System design and setup are accomplished using Lutron GRAFIK 6000 setup software on a personal computer.
